text: Hey guys, it's Angel
Today I'm going to show you how to make a
popular grass jelly desert
we call it "Xiān cǎo"
It's almost like a black jello but it tastes kind of herbal and
If you haven't seen it before, they usually sell them in these cans like this or
even if you're lucky in a powdered form
Now I got my grass jelly in Chinatown
and you can usually find it at your local asian grocery store
I find that it's becoming more and more common
You can also find it online as well
Now if you haven't had grass jelly before
I feel like it tastes kind of herbal
But even though it's herbal, it does have a cooling feature to it so in traditional chinese medicine
grass jelly is very cooling for the body
which makes it a great summer dessert or even a low-calorie refreshing dessert
So with that let's get started
All right so the first thing we'll need is a can of grass jelly
it looks like this
Now if you're lucky, you'll find powdered ones but it's okay to go ahead and use canned grass jelly
because that's the most common
And after you buy it
Go ahead and put it in your fridge so that way when you're ready to use it, everything's cold
Next we're gonna make some syrup for our dessert
and behind me I have some syrup that I made earlier
Now this is just a brown sugar syrup
So earlier I took one cup of hot boiling water
added a quarter cup of brown sugar
and stir with a spoon to dissolve
then I put that in the fridge for a few hours so we have chilled syrup
Now of course depending on how sweet you like your desserts
you can always modify the sugar levels
Next let's cook the mochi balls
I'm using a bag of frozen sweet rice balls in a white and pink color
which are super easy to cook
Just bring a pot of water to a rolling boil
then add the mochi balls and gently stir until the mochi begins to float
Boil for three to four minutes
and then drain and rinse with cold water
and set aside in a bowl with ice to quickly cool
Adding the ice in this step will help make the mochi balls chewier
Next let's prepare the grass jelly
If you're using canned grass jelly like I am today
drain any excess liquid before cutting into smaller pieces or cubes
and placing them in a medium-sized serving bowl
Add some of the cooked mochi balls on top
top with some additional ice cubes
Finally pour over with a simple brown sugar syrup for a chilled grass jelly and mochi dessert
And that is how you make a taiwanese grass jelly dessert with mochi balls
So now I'm gonna do a quick taste test
and if you're wondering
I would probably serve this for two or three people
this is a lot of dessert right here for one person
so this is definitely one of those times where sharing is caring
Alright I just had a white mochi ball
now I have to have a pink mochi ball because pink is one of my favorite colors
The grass jelly is herbal tasting which is really kind of cooling
You'll notice it immediately once you eat it
Thank you guys so much for watching
I hope you enjoyed this quick and easy dessert recipe
If you guys like grass jelly give me a thumbs up
I am always wondering if there's other grass jelly lovers out there
because it is a kind of a weird looking dessert
and it is kind of herbal so I'm not always sure if people like it
Take care guys and I will see you in the next one
Bye!
